titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: John Percy Moore (1869-1965) was a university professor and world recognized authority on leeches. He was educated at the University of Pennsylvania, receiving his bachelor's degree in 1892 and his Ph.D. in 1896. His teaching career began in 1890, when he was appointed Assistant Instructor of Zoology at the University of Pennsylvania. He was promoted to Instructor in 1892, Assistant Professor in 1907, and Professor in 1912. In 1939 he became Emeritus Professor. Moore was also an Assistant Curator and Corresponding Secretary for the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia from 1902 to 1939 and a member of the Board of Trustees from 1938 to 1957. In 1957 he was made an Honorary Life Trustee of the Academy.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains documentation related to the following topics: general Academy and Academy Library business; the Library Committee; minutes and correspondence from the Academy's Board of Trustees (1950s); visual materials such as illustrations, lantern slides, glass plates negatives, film negatives, 16mm film, and photographs; the Ludwick Institute, including correspondence, memoranda, and lecture announcements; professional correspondence from 1904-1944; field notes on leeches, mosquitoes, and other subjects; manuscripts; typescripts of articles; reprints of articles by Moore and others; notes for a biography of Leidy; notes and correspondence about S.G. Morton and William Maclure; lecture notes for biology classes at Penn; Moore's notes on Cope's lectures on Vertebrata (1899-99); correspondence on Leidy specimens (1920s-1930s); and a copy of G.H. Parker's biography of Leidy, 1951.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: J. P. Moore papers (collection 505).
